27#include "includes.h"
28__RCSID("$NetBSD: sshkey-xmss.c,v 1.4 2019/01/27 02:08:33 pgoyette Exp $");

30#include <sys/types.h>
31#include <sys/uio.h>
32
33#include <stdio.h>
34#include <string.h>
35#include <unistd.h>
36#include <fcntl.h>
37#include <errno.h>

39#include "ssh2.h"
40#include "ssherr.h"
41#include "sshbuf.h"
42#include "cipher.h"
43#include "sshkey.h"
44#include "sshkey-xmss.h"
45#include "atomicio.h"
46
47#include "xmss_fast.h"
48
49/* opaque internal XMSS state */
50#define XMSS_MAGIC "xmss-state-v1"
51#define XMSS_CIPHERNAME "aes256-gcm@openssh.com"
52struct ssh_xmss_state {
53 xmss_params params;
54 u_int32_t n, w, h, k;
55
56 bds_state bds;
57 u_char *stack;
58 u_int32_t stackoffset;
59 u_char *stacklevels;
60 u_char *auth;
61 u_char *keep;
62 u_char *th_nodes;
63 u_char *retain;
64 treehash_inst *treehash;
65
66 u_int32_t idx; /* state read from file */
67 u_int32_t maxidx; /* restricted # of signatures */
68 int have_state; /* .state file exists */
69 int lockfd; /* locked in sshkey_xmss_get_state() */
70 int allow_update; /* allow sshkey_xmss_update_state() */
71 char *enc_ciphername;/* encrypt state with cipher */
72 u_char *enc_keyiv; /* encrypt state with key */
73 u_int32_t enc_keyiv_len; /* length of enc_keyiv */
74};
75
76int sshkey_xmss_init_bds_state(struct sshkey *);
77int sshkey_xmss_init_enc_key(struct sshkey *, const char *);
78void sshkey_xmss_free_bds(struct sshkey *);
79int sshkey_xmss_get_state_from_file(struct sshkey *, const char *,
80 int *, sshkey_printfn *);
81int sshkey_xmss_encrypt_state(const struct sshkey *, struct sshbuf *,
82 struct sshbuf **);
83int sshkey_xmss_decrypt_state(const struct sshkey *, struct sshbuf *,
84 struct sshbuf **);
85int sshkey_xmss_serialize_enc_key(const struct sshkey *, struct sshbuf *);
86int sshkey_xmss_deserialize_enc_key(struct sshkey *, struct sshbuf *);
87
88#define PRINT(s...) do { if (pr) pr(s); } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
89
90int
91sshkey_xmss_init(struct sshkey *key, const char *name)
92{
93 struct ssh_xmss_state *state;
94
95 if (key->xmss_state != NULL)
96 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_FORMAT;
97 if (name == NULL)
98 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_FORMAT;
99 state = calloc(sizeof(struct ssh_xmss_state), 1);
100 if (state == NULL)
101 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
102 if (strcmp(name, XMSS_SHA2_256_W16_H10_NAME) == 0) {
103 state->n = 32;
104 state->w = 16;
105 state->h = 10;
106 } else if (strcmp(name, XMSS_SHA2_256_W16_H16_NAME) == 0) {
107 state->n = 32;
108 state->w = 16;
109 state->h = 16;
110 } else if (strcmp(name, XMSS_SHA2_256_W16_H20_NAME) == 0) {
111 state->n = 32;
112 state->w = 16;
113 state->h = 20;
114 } else {
115 free(state);
116 return SSH_ERR_KEY_TYPE_UNKNOWN;
117 }
118 if ((key->xmss_name = strdup(name)) == NULL) {
119 free(state);
120 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
121 }
122 state->k = 2; /* XXX hardcoded */
123 state->lockfd = -1;
124 if (xmss_set_params(&state->params, state->n, state->h, state->w,
125 state->k) != 0) {
126 free(state);
127 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_FORMAT;
128 }
129 key->xmss_state = state;
130 return 0;
131}
132
133void
134sshkey_xmss_free_state(struct sshkey *key)
135{
136 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = key->xmss_state;
137
138 sshkey_xmss_free_bds(key);
139 if (state) {
140 if (state->enc_keyiv) {
141 explicit_bzero(state->enc_keyiv, state->enc_keyiv_len);
142 free(state->enc_keyiv);
143 }
144 free(state->enc_ciphername);
145 free(state);
146 }
147 key->xmss_state = NULL;
148}
149
150#define SSH_XMSS_K2_MAGIC "k=2"
151#define num_stack(x) ((x->h+1)*(x->n))
152#define num_stacklevels(x) (x->h+1)
153#define num_auth(x) ((x->h)*(x->n))
154#define num_keep(x) ((x->h >> 1)*(x->n))
155#define num_th_nodes(x) ((x->h - x->k)*(x->n))
156#define num_retain(x) (((1ULL << x->k) - x->k - 1) * (x->n))
157#define num_treehash(x) ((x->h) - (x->k))
158
159int
160sshkey_xmss_init_bds_state(struct sshkey *key)
161{
162 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = key->xmss_state;
163 u_int32_t i;
164
165 state->stackoffset = 0;
166 if ((state->stack = calloc(num_stack(state), 1)) == NULL ||
167 (state->stacklevels = calloc(num_stacklevels(state), 1))== NULL ||
168 (state->auth = calloc(num_auth(state), 1)) == NULL ||
169 (state->keep = calloc(num_keep(state), 1)) == NULL ||
170 (state->th_nodes = calloc(num_th_nodes(state), 1)) == NULL ||
171 (state->retain = calloc(num_retain(state), 1)) == NULL ||
172 (state->treehash = calloc(num_treehash(state),
173 sizeof(treehash_inst))) == NULL) {
174 sshkey_xmss_free_bds(key);
175 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
176 }
177 for (i = 0; i < state->h - state->k; i++)
178 state->treehash[i].node = &state->th_nodes[state->n*i];
179 xmss_set_bds_state(&state->bds, state->stack, state->stackoffset,
180 state->stacklevels, state->auth, state->keep, state->treehash,
181 state->retain, 0);
182 return 0;
183}
184
185void
186sshkey_xmss_free_bds(struct sshkey *key)
187{
188 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = key->xmss_state;
189
190 if (state == NULL)
191 return;
192 free(state->stack);
193 free(state->stacklevels);
194 free(state->auth);
195 free(state->keep);
196 free(state->th_nodes);
197 free(state->retain);
198 free(state->treehash);
199 state->stack = NULL;
200 state->stacklevels = NULL;
201 state->auth = NULL;
202 state->keep = NULL;
203 state->th_nodes = NULL;
204 state->retain = NULL;
205 state->treehash = NULL;
206}
207
208void *
209sshkey_xmss_params(const struct sshkey *key)
210{
211 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = key->xmss_state;
212
213 if (state == NULL)
214 return NULL;
215 return &state->params;
216}
217
218void *
219sshkey_xmss_bds_state(const struct sshkey *key)
220{
221 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = key->xmss_state;
222
223 if (state == NULL)
224 return NULL;
225 return &state->bds;
226}
227
228int
229sshkey_xmss_siglen(const struct sshkey *key, size_t *lenp)
230{
231 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = key->xmss_state;
232
233 if (lenp == NULL)
234 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
235 if (state == NULL)
236 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_FORMAT;
237 *lenp = 4 + state->n +
238 state->params.wots_par.keysize +
239 state->h * state->n;
240 return 0;
241}
242
243size_t
244sshkey_xmss_pklen(const struct sshkey *key)
245{
246 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = key->xmss_state;
247
248 if (state == NULL)
249 return 0;
250 return state->n * 2;
251}
252
253size_t
254sshkey_xmss_sklen(const struct sshkey *key)
255{
256 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = key->xmss_state;
257
258 if (state == NULL)
259 return 0;
260 return state->n * 4 + 4;
261}
262
263int
264sshkey_xmss_init_enc_key(struct sshkey *k, const char *ciphername)
265{
266 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = k->xmss_state;
267 const struct sshcipher *cipher;
268 size_t keylen = 0, ivlen = 0;
269
270 if (state == NULL)
271 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
272 if ((cipher = cipher_by_name(ciphername)) == NULL)
273 return SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
274 if ((state->enc_ciphername = strdup(ciphername)) == NULL)
275 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
276 keylen = cipher_keylen(cipher);
277 ivlen = cipher_ivlen(cipher);
278 state->enc_keyiv_len = keylen + ivlen;
279 if ((state->enc_keyiv = calloc(state->enc_keyiv_len, 1)) == NULL) {
280 free(state->enc_ciphername);
281 state->enc_ciphername = NULL;
282 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
283 }
284 arc4random_buf(state->enc_keyiv, state->enc_keyiv_len);
285 return 0;
286}
287
288int
289sshkey_xmss_serialize_enc_key(const struct sshkey *k, struct sshbuf *b)
290{
291 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = k->xmss_state;
292 int r;
293
294 if (state == NULL || state->enc_keyiv == NULL ||
295 state->enc_ciphername == NULL)
296 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
297 if ((r = sshbuf_put_cstring(b, state->enc_ciphername)) != 0 ||
298 (r = sshbuf_put_string(b, state->enc_keyiv,
299 state->enc_keyiv_len)) != 0)
300 return r;
301 return 0;
302}
303
304int
305sshkey_xmss_deserialize_enc_key(struct sshkey *k, struct sshbuf *b)
306{
307 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = k->xmss_state;
308 size_t len;
309 int r;
310
311 if (state == NULL)
312 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
313 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(b, &state->enc_ciphername, NULL)) != 0 ||
314 (r = sshbuf_get_string(b, &state->enc_keyiv, &len)) != 0)
315 return r;
316 state->enc_keyiv_len = len;
317 return 0;
318}
319
320int
321sshkey_xmss_serialize_pk_info(const struct sshkey *k, struct sshbuf *b,
322 enum sshkey_serialize_rep opts)
323{
324 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = k->xmss_state;
325 u_char have_info = 1;
326 u_int32_t idx;
327 int r;
328
329 if (state == NULL)
330 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
331 if (opts != SSHKEY_SERIALIZE_INFO)
332 return 0;
333 idx = k->xmss_sk ? PEEK_U32(k->xmss_sk) : state->idx;
334 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(b, have_info)) != 0 ||
335 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(b, idx)) != 0 ||
336 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(b, state->maxidx)) != 0)
337 return r;
338 return 0;
339}
340
341int
342sshkey_xmss_deserialize_pk_info(struct sshkey *k, struct sshbuf *b)
343{
344 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = k->xmss_state;
345 u_char have_info;
346 int r;
347
348 if (state == NULL)
349 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
350 /* optional */
351 if (sshbuf_len(b) == 0)
352 return 0;
353 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u8(b, &have_info)) != 0)
354 return r;
355 if (have_info != 1)
356 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
357 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u32(b, &state->idx)) != 0 ||
358 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(b, &state->maxidx)) != 0)
359 return r;
360 return 0;
361}
362
363int
364sshkey_xmss_generate_private_key(struct sshkey *k, u_int bits)
365{
366 int r;
367 const char *name;
368
369 if (bits == 10) {
370 name = XMSS_SHA2_256_W16_H10_NAME;
371 } else if (bits == 16) {
372 name = XMSS_SHA2_256_W16_H16_NAME;
373 } else if (bits == 20) {
374 name = XMSS_SHA2_256_W16_H20_NAME;
375 } else {
376 name = XMSS_DEFAULT_NAME;
377 }
378 if ((r = sshkey_xmss_init(k, name)) != 0 ||
379 (r = sshkey_xmss_init_bds_state(k)) != 0 ||
380 (r = sshkey_xmss_init_enc_key(k, XMSS_CIPHERNAME)) != 0)
381 return r;
382 if ((k->xmss_pk = malloc(sshkey_xmss_pklen(k))) == NULL ||
383 (k->xmss_sk = malloc(sshkey_xmss_sklen(k))) == NULL) {
384 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
385 }
386 xmss_keypair(k->xmss_pk, k->xmss_sk, sshkey_xmss_bds_state(k),
387 sshkey_xmss_params(k));
388 return 0;
389}
390
391int
392sshkey_xmss_get_state_from_file(struct sshkey *k, const char *filename,
393 int *have_file, sshkey_printfn *pr)
394{
395 struct sshbuf *b = NULL, *enc = NULL;
396 int ret = SSH_ERR_SYSTEM_ERROR, r, fd = -1;
397 u_int32_t len;
398 unsigned char buf[4], *data = NULL;
399
400 *have_file = 0;
401 if ((fd = open(filename, O_RDONLY)) >= 0) {
402 *have_file = 1;
403 if (atomicio(read, fd, buf, sizeof(buf)) != sizeof(buf)) {
404 PRINT("%s: corrupt state file: %s", __func__, filename);
405 goto done;
406 }
407 len = PEEK_U32(buf);
408 if ((data = calloc(len, 1)) == NULL) {
409 ret = SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
410 goto done;
411 }
412 if (atomicio(read, fd, data, len) != len) {
413 PRINT("%s: cannot read blob: %s", __func__, filename);
414 goto done;
415 }
416 if ((enc = sshbuf_from(data, len)) == NULL) {
417 ret = SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
418 goto done;
419 }
420 sshkey_xmss_free_bds(k);
421 if ((r = sshkey_xmss_decrypt_state(k, enc, &b)) != 0) {
422 ret = r;
423 goto done;
424 }
425 if ((r = sshkey_xmss_deserialize_state(k, b)) != 0) {
426 ret = r;
427 goto done;
428 }
429 ret = 0;
430 }
431done:
432 if (fd != -1)
433 close(fd);
434 free(data);
435 sshbuf_free(enc);
436 sshbuf_free(b);
437 return ret;
438}
439
440int
441sshkey_xmss_get_state(const struct sshkey *k, sshkey_printfn *pr)
442{
443 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = k->xmss_state;
444 u_int32_t idx = 0;
445 char *filename = NULL;
446 char *statefile = NULL, *ostatefile = NULL, *lockfile = NULL;
447 int lockfd = -1, have_state = 0, have_ostate, tries = 0;
448 int ret = SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT, r;
449
450 if (state == NULL)
451 goto done;
452 /*
453 * If maxidx is set, then we are allowed a limited number
454 * of signatures, but don't need to access the disk.
455 * Otherwise we need to deal with the on-disk state.
456 */
457 if (state->maxidx) {
458 /* xmss_sk always contains the current state */
459 idx = PEEK_U32(k->xmss_sk);
460 if (idx < state->maxidx) {
461 state->allow_update = 1;
462 return 0;
463 }
464 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
465 }
466 if ((filename = k->xmss_filename) == NULL)
467 goto done;
468 if (asprintf(&lockfile, "%s.lock", filename) < 0 ||
469 asprintf(&statefile, "%s.state", filename) < 0 ||
470 asprintf(&ostatefile, "%s.ostate", filename) < 0) {
471 ret = SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
472 goto done;
473 }
474 if ((lockfd = open(lockfile, O_CREAT|O_RDONLY, 0600)) < 0) {
475 ret = SSH_ERR_SYSTEM_ERROR;
476 PRINT("%s: cannot open/create: %s", __func__, lockfile);
477 goto done;
478 }
479 while (flock(lockfd, LOCK_EX|LOCK_NB) < 0) {
480 if (errno != EWOULDBLOCK) {
481 ret = SSH_ERR_SYSTEM_ERROR;
482 PRINT("%s: cannot lock: %s", __func__, lockfile);
483 goto done;
484 }
485 if (++tries > 10) {
486 ret = SSH_ERR_SYSTEM_ERROR;
487 PRINT("%s: giving up on: %s", __func__, lockfile);
488 goto done;
489 }
490 usleep(1000*100*tries);
491 }
492 /* XXX no longer const */
493 if ((r = sshkey_xmss_get_state_from_file(__UNCONST(k),
494 statefile, &have_state, pr)) != 0) {
495 if ((r = sshkey_xmss_get_state_from_file(__UNCONST(k),
496 ostatefile, &have_ostate, pr)) == 0) {
497 state->allow_update = 1;
498 r = sshkey_xmss_forward_state(k, 1);
499 state->idx = PEEK_U32(k->xmss_sk);
500 state->allow_update = 0;
501 }
502 }
503 if (!have_state && !have_ostate) {
504 /* check that bds state is initialized */
505 if (state->bds.auth == NULL)
506 goto done;
507 PRINT("%s: start from scratch idx 0: %u", __func__, state->idx);
508 } else if (r != 0) {
509 ret = r;
510 goto done;
511 }
512 if (state->idx + 1 < state->idx) {
513 PRINT("%s: state wrap: %u", __func__, state->idx);
514 goto done;
515 }
516 state->have_state = have_state;
517 state->lockfd = lockfd;
518 state->allow_update = 1;
519 lockfd = -1;
520 ret = 0;
521done:
522 if (lockfd != -1)
523 close(lockfd);
524 free(lockfile);
525 free(statefile);
526 free(ostatefile);
527 return ret;
528}
529
530int
531sshkey_xmss_forward_state(const struct sshkey *k, u_int32_t reserve)
532{
533 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = k->xmss_state;
534 u_char *sig = NULL;
535 size_t required_siglen;
536 unsigned long long smlen;
537 u_char data;
538 int ret, r;
539
540 if (state == NULL || !state->allow_update)
541 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
542 if (reserve == 0)
543 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
544 if (state->idx + reserve <= state->idx)
545 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
546 if ((r = sshkey_xmss_siglen(k, &required_siglen)) != 0)
547 return r;
548 if ((sig = malloc(required_siglen)) == NULL)
549 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
550 while (reserve-- > 0) {
551 state->idx = PEEK_U32(k->xmss_sk);
552 smlen = required_siglen;
553 if ((ret = xmss_sign(k->xmss_sk, sshkey_xmss_bds_state(k),
554 sig, &smlen, &data, 0, sshkey_xmss_params(k))) != 0) {
555 r = SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
556 break;
557 }
558 }
559 free(sig);
560 return r;
561}
562
563int
564sshkey_xmss_update_state(const struct sshkey *k, sshkey_printfn *pr)
565{
566 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = k->xmss_state;
567 struct sshbuf *b = NULL, *enc = NULL;
568 u_int32_t idx = 0;
569 unsigned char buf[4];
570 char *filename = NULL;
571 char *statefile = NULL, *ostatefile = NULL, *nstatefile = NULL;
572 int fd = -1;
573 int ret = SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
574
575 if (state == NULL || !state->allow_update)
576 return ret;
577 if (state->maxidx) {
578 /* no update since the number of signatures is limited */
579 ret = 0;
580 goto done;
581 }
582 idx = PEEK_U32(k->xmss_sk);
583 if (idx == state->idx) {
584 /* no signature happened, no need to update */
585 ret = 0;
586 goto done;
587 } else if (idx != state->idx + 1) {
588 PRINT("%s: more than one signature happened: idx %u state %u",
589 __func__, idx, state->idx);
590 goto done;
591 }
592 state->idx = idx;
593 if ((filename = k->xmss_filename) == NULL)
594 goto done;
595 if (asprintf(&statefile, "%s.state", filename) < 0 ||
596 asprintf(&ostatefile, "%s.ostate", filename) < 0 ||
597 asprintf(&nstatefile, "%s.nstate", filename) < 0) {
598 ret = SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
599 goto done;
600 }
601 unlink(nstatefile);
602 if ((b = sshbuf_new()) == NULL) {
603 ret = SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
604 goto done;
605 }
606 if ((ret = sshkey_xmss_serialize_state(k, b)) != 0) {
607 PRINT("%s: SERLIALIZE FAILED: %d", __func__, ret);
608 goto done;
609 }
610 if ((ret = sshkey_xmss_encrypt_state(k, b, &enc)) != 0) {
611 PRINT("%s: ENCRYPT FAILED: %d", __func__, ret);
612 goto done;
613 }
614 if ((fd = open(nstatefile, O_CREAT|O_WRONLY|O_EXCL, 0600)) < 0) {
615 ret = SSH_ERR_SYSTEM_ERROR;
616 PRINT("%s: open new state file: %s", __func__, nstatefile);
617 goto done;
618 }
619 POKE_U32(buf, sshbuf_len(enc));
620 if (atomicio(vwrite, fd, buf, sizeof(buf)) != sizeof(buf)) {
621 ret = SSH_ERR_SYSTEM_ERROR;
622 PRINT("%s: write new state file hdr: %s", __func__, nstatefile);
623 close(fd);
624 goto done;
625 }
626 if (atomicio(vwrite, fd, sshbuf_mutable_ptr(enc), sshbuf_len(enc)) !=
627 sshbuf_len(enc)) {
628 ret = SSH_ERR_SYSTEM_ERROR;
629 PRINT("%s: write new state file data: %s", __func__, nstatefile);
630 close(fd);
631 goto done;
632 }
633 if (fsync(fd) < 0) {
634 ret = SSH_ERR_SYSTEM_ERROR;
635 PRINT("%s: sync new state file: %s", __func__, nstatefile);
636 close(fd);
637 goto done;
638 }
639 if (close(fd) < 0) {
640 ret = SSH_ERR_SYSTEM_ERROR;
641 PRINT("%s: close new state file: %s", __func__, nstatefile);
642 goto done;
643 }
644 if (state->have_state) {
645 unlink(ostatefile);
646 if (link(statefile, ostatefile)) {
647 ret = SSH_ERR_SYSTEM_ERROR;
648 PRINT("%s: backup state %s to %s", __func__, statefile,
649 ostatefile);
650 goto done;
651 }
652 }
653 if (rename(nstatefile, statefile) < 0) {
654 ret = SSH_ERR_SYSTEM_ERROR;
655 PRINT("%s: rename %s to %s", __func__, nstatefile, statefile);
656 goto done;
657 }
658 ret = 0;
659done:
660 if (state->lockfd != -1) {
661 close(state->lockfd);
662 state->lockfd = -1;
663 }
664 if (nstatefile)
665 unlink(nstatefile);
666 free(statefile);
667 free(ostatefile);
668 free(nstatefile);
669 sshbuf_free(b);
670 sshbuf_free(enc);
671 return ret;
672}
673
674int
675sshkey_xmss_serialize_state(const struct sshkey *k, struct sshbuf *b)
676{
677 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = k->xmss_state;
678 treehash_inst *th;
679 u_int32_t i, node;
680 int r;
681
682 if (state == NULL)
683 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
684 if (state->stack == NULL)
685 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
686 state->stackoffset = state->bds.stackoffset; /* copy back */
687 if ((r = sshbuf_put_cstring(b, SSH_XMSS_K2_MAGIC)) != 0 ||
688 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(b, state->idx)) != 0 ||
689 (r = sshbuf_put_string(b, state->stack, num_stack(state))) != 0 ||
690 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(b, state->stackoffset)) != 0 ||
691 (r = sshbuf_put_string(b, state->stacklevels, num_stacklevels(state))) != 0 ||
692 (r = sshbuf_put_string(b, state->auth, num_auth(state))) != 0 ||
693 (r = sshbuf_put_string(b, state->keep, num_keep(state))) != 0 ||
694 (r = sshbuf_put_string(b, state->th_nodes, num_th_nodes(state))) != 0 ||
695 (r = sshbuf_put_string(b, state->retain, num_retain(state))) != 0 ||
696 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(b, num_treehash(state))) != 0)
697 return r;
698 for (i = 0; i < num_treehash(state); i++) {
699 th = &state->treehash[i];
700 node = th->node - state->th_nodes;
701 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u32(b, th->h)) != 0 ||
702 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(b, th->next_idx)) != 0 ||
703 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(b, th->stackusage)) != 0 ||
704 (r = sshbuf_put_u8(b, th->completed)) != 0 ||
705 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(b, node)) != 0)
706 return r;
707 }
708 return 0;
709}
710
711int
712sshkey_xmss_serialize_state_opt(const struct sshkey *k, struct sshbuf *b,
713 enum sshkey_serialize_rep opts)
714{
715 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = k->xmss_state;
716 int r = SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
717
718 if (state == NULL)
719 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
720 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(b, opts)) != 0)
721 return r;
722 switch (opts) {
723 case SSHKEY_SERIALIZE_STATE:
724 r = sshkey_xmss_serialize_state(k, b);
725 break;
726 case SSHKEY_SERIALIZE_FULL:
727 if ((r = sshkey_xmss_serialize_enc_key(k, b)) != 0)
728 break;
729 r = sshkey_xmss_serialize_state(k, b);
730 break;
731 case SSHKEY_SERIALIZE_DEFAULT:
732 r = 0;
733 break;
734 default:
735 r = SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
736 break;
737 }
738 return r;
739}
740
741int
742sshkey_xmss_deserialize_state(struct sshkey *k, struct sshbuf *b)
743{
744 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = k->xmss_state;
745 treehash_inst *th;
746 u_int32_t i, lh, node;
747 size_t ls, lsl, la, lk, ln, lr;
748 char *magic;
749 int r;
750
751 if (state == NULL)
752 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
753 if (k->xmss_sk == NULL)
754 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
755 if ((state->treehash = calloc(num_treehash(state),
756 sizeof(treehash_inst))) == NULL)
757 return SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
758 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(b, &magic, NULL)) != 0 ||
759 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(b, &state->idx)) != 0 ||
760 (r = sshbuf_get_string(b, &state->stack, &ls)) != 0 ||
761 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(b, &state->stackoffset)) != 0 ||
762 (r = sshbuf_get_string(b, &state->stacklevels, &lsl)) != 0 ||
763 (r = sshbuf_get_string(b, &state->auth, &la)) != 0 ||
764 (r = sshbuf_get_string(b, &state->keep, &lk)) != 0 ||
765 (r = sshbuf_get_string(b, &state->th_nodes, &ln)) != 0 ||
766 (r = sshbuf_get_string(b, &state->retain, &lr)) != 0 ||
767 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(b, &lh)) != 0)
768 return r;
769 if (strcmp(magic, SSH_XMSS_K2_MAGIC) != 0)
770 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
771 /* XXX check stackoffset */
772 if (ls != num_stack(state) ||
773 lsl != num_stacklevels(state) ||
774 la != num_auth(state) ||
775 lk != num_keep(state) ||
776 ln != num_th_nodes(state) ||
777 lr != num_retain(state) ||
778 lh != num_treehash(state))
779 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
780 for (i = 0; i < num_treehash(state); i++) {
781 th = &state->treehash[i];
782 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u32(b, &th->h)) != 0 ||
783 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(b, &th->next_idx)) != 0 ||
784 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(b, &th->stackusage)) != 0 ||
785 (r = sshbuf_get_u8(b, &th->completed)) != 0 ||
786 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(b, &node)) != 0)
787 return r;
788 if (node < num_th_nodes(state))
789 th->node = &state->th_nodes[node];
790 }
791 POKE_U32(k->xmss_sk, state->idx);
792 xmss_set_bds_state(&state->bds, state->stack, state->stackoffset,
793 state->stacklevels, state->auth, state->keep, state->treehash,
794 state->retain, 0);
795 return 0;
796}
797
798int
799sshkey_xmss_deserialize_state_opt(struct sshkey *k, struct sshbuf *b)
800{
801 enum sshkey_serialize_rep opts;
802 u_char have_state;
803 int r;
804
805 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u8(b, &have_state)) != 0)
806 return r;
807
808 opts = have_state;
809 switch (opts) {
810 case SSHKEY_SERIALIZE_DEFAULT:
811 r = 0;
812 break;
813 case SSHKEY_SERIALIZE_STATE:
814 if ((r = sshkey_xmss_deserialize_state(k, b)) != 0)
815 return r;
816 break;
817 case SSHKEY_SERIALIZE_FULL:
818 if ((r = sshkey_xmss_deserialize_enc_key(k, b)) != 0 ||
819 (r = sshkey_xmss_deserialize_state(k, b)) != 0)
820 return r;
821 break;
822 default:
823 r = SSH_ERR_INVALID_FORMAT;
824 break;
825 }
826 return r;
827}
828
829int
830sshkey_xmss_encrypt_state(const struct sshkey *k, struct sshbuf *b,
831 struct sshbuf **retp)
832{
833 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = k->xmss_state;
834 struct sshbuf *encrypted = NULL, *encoded = NULL, *padded = NULL;
835 struct sshcipher_ctx *ciphercontext = NULL;
836 const struct sshcipher *cipher;
837 u_char *cp, *key, *iv = NULL;
838 size_t i, keylen, ivlen, blocksize, authlen, encrypted_len, aadlen;
839 int r = SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
840
841 if (retp != NULL)
842 *retp = NULL;
843 if (state == NULL ||
844 state->enc_keyiv == NULL ||
845 state->enc_ciphername == NULL)
846 return SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
847 if ((cipher = cipher_by_name(state->enc_ciphername)) == NULL) {
848 r = SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
849 goto out;
850 }
851 blocksize = cipher_blocksize(cipher);
852 keylen = cipher_keylen(cipher);
853 ivlen = cipher_ivlen(cipher);
854 authlen = cipher_authlen(cipher);
855 if (state->enc_keyiv_len != keylen + ivlen) {
856 r = SSH_ERR_INVALID_FORMAT;
857 goto out;
858 }
859 key = state->enc_keyiv;
860 if ((encrypted = sshbuf_new()) == NULL ||
861 (encoded = sshbuf_new()) == NULL ||
862 (padded = sshbuf_new()) == NULL ||
863 (iv = malloc(ivlen)) == NULL) {
864 r = SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
865 goto out;
866 }
867
868 /* replace first 4 bytes of IV with index to ensure uniqueness */
869 memcpy(iv, key + keylen, ivlen);
870 POKE_U32(iv, state->idx);
871
872 if ((r = sshbuf_put(encoded, XMSS_MAGIC, sizeof(XMSS_MAGIC))) != 0 ||
873 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(encoded, state->idx)) != 0)
874 goto out;
875
876 /* padded state will be encrypted */
877 if ((r = sshbuf_putb(padded, b)) != 0)
878 goto out;
879 i = 0;
880 while (sshbuf_len(padded) % blocksize) {
881 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(padded, ++i & 0xff)) != 0)
882 goto out;
883 }
884 encrypted_len = sshbuf_len(padded);
885
886 /* header including the length of state is used as AAD */
887 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u32(encoded, encrypted_len)) != 0)
888 goto out;
889 aadlen = sshbuf_len(encoded);
890
891 /* concat header and state */
892 if ((r = sshbuf_putb(encoded, padded)) != 0)
893 goto out;
894
895 /* reserve space for encryption of encoded data plus auth tag */
896 /* encrypt at offset addlen */
897 if ((r = sshbuf_reserve(encrypted,
898 encrypted_len + aadlen + authlen, &cp)) != 0 ||
899 (r = cipher_init(&ciphercontext, cipher, key, keylen,
900 iv, ivlen, 1)) != 0 ||
901 (r = cipher_crypt(ciphercontext, 0, cp, sshbuf_ptr(encoded),
902 encrypted_len, aadlen, authlen)) != 0)
903 goto out;
904
905 /* success */
906 r = 0;
907 out:
908 if (retp != NULL) {
909 *retp = encrypted;
910 encrypted = NULL;
911 }
912 sshbuf_free(padded);
913 sshbuf_free(encoded);
914 sshbuf_free(encrypted);
915 cipher_free(ciphercontext);
916 free(iv);
917 return r;
918}
919
920int
921sshkey_xmss_decrypt_state(const struct sshkey *k, struct sshbuf *encoded,
922 struct sshbuf **retp)
923{
924 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = k->xmss_state;
925 struct sshbuf *copy = NULL, *decrypted = NULL;
926 struct sshcipher_ctx *ciphercontext = NULL;
927 const struct sshcipher *cipher = NULL;
928 u_char *key, *iv = NULL, *dp;
929 size_t keylen, ivlen, authlen, aadlen;
930 u_int blocksize, encrypted_len, index;
931 int r = SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
932
933 if (retp != NULL)
934 *retp = NULL;
935 if (state == NULL ||
936 state->enc_keyiv == NULL ||
937 state->enc_ciphername == NULL)
938 return SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
939 if ((cipher = cipher_by_name(state->enc_ciphername)) == NULL) {
940 r = SSH_ERR_INVALID_FORMAT;
941 goto out;
942 }
943 blocksize = cipher_blocksize(cipher);
944 keylen = cipher_keylen(cipher);
945 ivlen = cipher_ivlen(cipher);
946 authlen = cipher_authlen(cipher);
947 if (state->enc_keyiv_len != keylen + ivlen) {
948 r = SSH_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
949 goto out;
950 }
951 key = state->enc_keyiv;
952
953 if ((copy = sshbuf_fromb(encoded)) == NULL ||
954 (decrypted = sshbuf_new()) == NULL ||
955 (iv = malloc(ivlen)) == NULL) {
956 r = SSH_ERR_ALLOC_FAIL;
957 goto out;
958 }
959
960 /* check magic */
961 if (sshbuf_len(encoded) < sizeof(XMSS_MAGIC) ||
962 memcmp(sshbuf_ptr(encoded), XMSS_MAGIC, sizeof(XMSS_MAGIC))) {
963 r = SSH_ERR_INVALID_FORMAT;
964 goto out;
965 }
966 /* parse public portion */
967 if ((r = sshbuf_consume(encoded, sizeof(XMSS_MAGIC))) != 0 ||
968 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(encoded, &index)) != 0 ||
969 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(encoded, &encrypted_len)) != 0)
970 goto out;
971
972 /* check size of encrypted key blob */
973 if (encrypted_len < blocksize || (encrypted_len % blocksize) != 0) {
974 r = SSH_ERR_INVALID_FORMAT;
975 goto out;
976 }
977 /* check that an appropriate amount of auth data is present */
978 if (sshbuf_len(encoded) < encrypted_len + authlen) {
979 r = SSH_ERR_INVALID_FORMAT;
980 goto out;
981 }
982
983 aadlen = sshbuf_len(copy) - sshbuf_len(encoded);
984
985 /* replace first 4 bytes of IV with index to ensure uniqueness */
986 memcpy(iv, key + keylen, ivlen);
987 POKE_U32(iv, index);
988
989 /* decrypt private state of key */
990 if ((r = sshbuf_reserve(decrypted, aadlen + encrypted_len, &dp)) != 0 ||
991 (r = cipher_init(&ciphercontext, cipher, key, keylen,
992 iv, ivlen, 0)) != 0 ||
993 (r = cipher_crypt(ciphercontext, 0, dp, sshbuf_ptr(copy),
994 encrypted_len, aadlen, authlen)) != 0)
995 goto out;
996
997 /* there should be no trailing data */
998 if ((r = sshbuf_consume(encoded, encrypted_len + authlen)) != 0)
999 goto out;
1000 if (sshbuf_len(encoded) != 0) {
1001 r = SSH_ERR_INVALID_FORMAT;
1002 goto out;
1003 }
1004
1005 /* remove AAD */
1006 if ((r = sshbuf_consume(decrypted, aadlen)) != 0)
1007 goto out;
1008 /* XXX encrypted includes unchecked padding */
1009
1010 /* success */
1011 r = 0;
1012 if (retp != NULL) {
1013 *retp = decrypted;
1014 decrypted = NULL;
1015 }
1016 out:
1017 cipher_free(ciphercontext);
1018 sshbuf_free(copy);
1019 sshbuf_free(decrypted);
1020 free(iv);
1021 return r;
1022}
1023
1024u_int32_t
1025sshkey_xmss_signatures_left(const struct sshkey *k)
1026{
1027 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = k->xmss_state;
1028 u_int32_t idx;
1029
1030 if (sshkey_type_plain(k->type) == KEY_XMSS && state &&
1031 state->maxidx) {
1032 idx = k->xmss_sk ? PEEK_U32(k->xmss_sk) : state->idx;
1033 if (idx < state->maxidx)
1034 return state->maxidx - idx;
1035 }
1036 return 0;
1037}
1038
1039int
1040sshkey_xmss_enable_maxsign(struct sshkey *k, u_int32_t maxsign)
1041{
1042 struct ssh_xmss_state *state = k->xmss_state;
1043
1044 if (sshkey_type_plain(k->type) != KEY_XMSS)
1045 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
1046 if (maxsign == 0)
1047 return 0;
1048 if (state->idx + maxsign < state->idx)
1049 return SSH_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
1050 state->maxidx = state->idx + maxsign;
1051 return 0;
1052}
